issue.title: 1478 statsmodels max_requirements

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This is a temporary fix for #1478, what looks like a bug introduced with `statsmodels` 0.13.0 through an interface hange that has not yet propagated to `tsfresh`.

Besides setting a max `statsmodels` version of 0.12.1 (the latest version before 0.13.0), it adds a `MAX_REQUIREMENTS` list to the `setup.py`.

issue.title: [MNT] adopt defensive upper version bounds on package dependencies

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
The `statsmodels` breakage has again shown us that under the current model, `sktime` is vulnerable to interface changes in other packages at version zero. See #1478.

Should we perhaps adopt a more defensive stance?

More precisely:

* upper version bounds for *all* dependencies
* at each release, we bump the upper bound to the current versions, or the highest versions that don't cause breakage
* if at a release we cannot move the upper bound to current version, we open a maintenance issue to log this

Opinions, @mloning, @aiwalter, @freddyaboulton?

body: are you going to report this issue to `tsfresh`? Otherwise, I can also open an issue there

Last version to have unbias is 0.11.1 https://www.statsmodels.org/v0.11.1/generated/statsmodels.tsa.stattools.acf.html

Edit:
'unbias' argument changed to 'adjusted' in later versions

my diagnosis seems incorrect then!

Thanks for looking into this, @yairbeer - I am at a loss then what is happening, since we had a minimum `statsmodels` of 0.12.1 already?

is the culprit `tsfresh` then, e.g., have they activated or added some bad code?

Or is sth happening in the reconciliation of package bounds for us?
no, but they have `statsmodels>=0.9.0` and probably didnt notice a deprecation notice from `statsmodels`.
so, yes the issue is `tsfresh` but we have to resolve it by excluding recent `statsnodels` version for now

that wouldn't work, because @yairbeer has localized the `statsmodels` interface change to between 0.11 and 0.12.
But we were using a lower bound of 0.12.1 already on `statsmodels`, and yesterday's update was to 0.13.

So an upper bound of 0.11.1 would conflict with our current lower bound of 0.12.1.
but before yesterday release its was fine, so excluding this should be the solution
#1481 just removes the failing tests - it won't fix the `tsfresh` related estimators from failing.

>but before yesterday release its was fine, so excluding this should be the solution

That's what I thought, but why does #1479 fail then?
forgot to update the build requirements, notebook installed 0.13.0, let's try again

ok, working hypothesis is that it was indeed the `statsmodels` upgrade to 0.13.0 that broke things - perhaps there was a silent lapse of deprecation which left it for longer in the code than it was in the docs.

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
We've temporarily solved #1478 by keeping `statsmodels` at 0.12.1, but that can't be a permanent solution.

This is a reminder that the solution to that is an outstanding issue.

body: that seems to have been the cause, since downgrade to 0.12.1 resolved the problem.

issue.title: Compatibility issue with statsmodels 0.18.0

repository.name: tsfresh
repository.description: Automatic extraction of relevant features from time series:

issue.body:
**The problem**:

Since v0.18.0, statsmodels stops supporting `unbiased` and uses `adjusted` (https://github.com/statsmodels/statsmodels/commit/3d6c3884b9804842ff039c8c5d63a9ccf519867a#diff-771ed9ae3d316dec0997427f2182d015dbfdaf6935335428bbf177ce1968bc72), and use of `statsmodels.tsa.stattools.acf` in `tsfresh.feature_extraction.ceature_calculators` now causes `TypeError`. We need to use `adjusted` instead of `unbiased` in calls for `acf` in statsmodels later than v0.14.0.
